pages.text: In no way do I claim to know what I’m doing. This book is mainly for fun and to show people things they might not have known. I know I’m someone who appreciates all types of tips, so even if you don’t find this book useful in the slightest, there might be someone out there who is really enjoying it!$(br2)This is just personally how I like to do things. Some people

have their own techniques, but at the end of the day, if you like how your builds come out and you found whatever you did worked best for you, then that’s all that matters. Everyone is different and there’s no reason to bully someone about how they like to do their craft.$(br2)While my stuff may not look the best, I'm usually satisfied with my end result. You might hate the way my terrain looks, but if you try it out, you might find that you just like the

techniques I use. I've been terraforming around 3-4 years for fun, but I didn't really get into until about 2 years ago, so I'm still constantly improving and learning new ways to do things.$(br2)I'm not the best builder though. I've made a few unique builds I'm proud of, but it's not too often I can create something solely from scratch that looks good. I typically copy references (sorry lol), but add some personal touches to it later on. That being said,
that's why I don't exactly mention how I build stuff other than giving a few examples of how I use my favorite building blocks! I only feel semi-confident in my terraforming skills.
